words.etymology: from suli (quiet/minimal) + kosa (thing) — smallest indivisible thing

example.voku: Ka tor kosa meke-pu eso suli-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL all thing create-PASS from atom
example.english: All things are made of atoms.

words.etymology: from suli-kosa (atom) abstracted to suli + supa (group) — atom group

example.voku: Ka ama ure suli-supa de-du suli-kosa en un.
example.gloss: DECL water be molecule of-two atom and one
example.english: Water is a molecule of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen.

example.voku: Ka tera tuve mani kona-kosa vari.
example.gloss: DECL earth have many element various
example.english: The earth has many different elements.

example.voku: Ka fuse-kosa meke-pu ta-tem du kona-kosa fuse-me ti.
example.gloss: DECL compound create-PASS when two element join-RECIP
example.english: A compound is created when two elements combine.

words.etymology: from mute (change) + kiru (logic/process) — systematic change process

example.voku: Ka mute-kiru meke fuse-kosa novi.
example.gloss: DECL reaction create compound new
example.english: The reaction creates a new compound.

example.voku: Ka kire-ama ure mali poro fela.
example.gloss: DECL acid be harmful for skin
example.english: Acid is harmful to the skin.

example.voku: Ka hele-ama mute kire-ama eko mu-mali.
example.gloss: DECL base change acid toward non-harmful
example.english: A base neutralizes an acid.

example.voku: Ka sela-mela fuse eno ama poro meke fuse-ama.
example.gloss: DECL salt join in water for make solution
example.english: Salt dissolves in water to make a solution.

example.voku: Ka suli-kosa liku-me ulo liku-kiru.
example.gloss: DECL atom link-RECIP via bond
example.english: Atoms link to each other through bonds.

example.voku: Ka pile-kosa tuve pile vali o pile mali.
example.gloss: DECL ion have charge positive or charge negative
example.english: An ion has a positive or negative charge.

example.voku: Ka rapi-mute meke mute-kiru rapi sino mute-se.
example.gloss: DECL catalyst make reaction fast without change-REFL
example.english: A catalyst speeds the reaction without being consumed.

example.voku: Ka soma meke-pu eso mani viva-pula.
example.gloss: DECL body create-PASS from many cell
example.english: The body is made of many cells.

example.voku: Ka viva-koda pine foma de-soma.
example.gloss: DECL gene define structure of-body
example.english: Genes define the body's structure.

words.etymology: from viva-koda (gene) + foma (structure) — gene code structure

example.voku: Ka viva-koda-foma sere tor kela de-viva.
example.gloss: DECL DNA store all data of-life
example.english: DNA stores all the information of life.

words.etymology: from viva (life) + foma (structure) — life structural molecule

example.voku: Ka viva-foma take mani rula eno viva-pula.
example.gloss: DECL protein do many role in cell
example.english: Proteins perform many roles in cells.

words.etymology: from soma (body) + kila (device/tool) — body functional device

example.voku: Ka kona ure soma-kila alati.
example.gloss: DECL heart be organ important
example.english: The heart is an important organ.

example.voku: Ka soma-kila meke-pu eso mani viva-tela.
example.gloss: DECL organ create-PASS from many tissue
example.english: Organs are made of many tissues.

words.etymology: from mali (bad) + puli (small) + viva (life) — small harmful life form

example.voku: Ka par mali-puli-viva kes hala-mali.
example.gloss: DECL some bacteria cause illness
example.english: Some bacteria cause illness.

words.etymology: from mali (harmful) + koda (code) + viva (life) — harmful code organism

example.voku: Ka mali-koda-viva zike viva-pula poro meke-se novi.
example.gloss: DECL virus enter cell for create-REFL new
example.english: A virus enters a cell to replicate itself.

words.etymology: from mute (change) + viva (life) — life change over time

example.voku: Ka mute-viva mute tor viva-foma eno tema lomi.
example.gloss: DECL evolution change all life-form in time long
example.english: Evolution changes all life forms over long periods.

example.voku: Ka tera tuve mani viva-supa vari.
example.gloss: DECL earth have many species various
example.english: The earth has many different species.

example.voku: Ka viva-teru neke tor viva-supa poro ure vali.
example.gloss: DECL ecosystem need all species for be healthy
example.english: An ecosystem needs all species to be healthy.

example.voku: Ka hale-runa pore hale-kosa eko mali-runa.
example.gloss: DECL doctor give medicine toward patient
example.english: The doctor gives medicine to the patient.

example.voku: De nor ane hale-vasa ta hale-runa pine ti.
example.gloss: DEON 2SG take dose REL doctor prescribe
example.english: You must take the dose the doctor prescribes.

example.voku: Ka homi-soma ure mali-seta de-hala-mali.
example.gloss: DECL fever be symptom of-illness
example.english: Fever is a symptom of illness.

words.etymology: from tore (search) + mali (bad/illness) — search for illness/diagnosis

example.voku: Ka hale-runa take tore-mali poro kele hala-mali.
example.gloss: DECL doctor do diagnosis for know illness
example.english: The doctor makes a diagnosis to identify the illness.

example.voku: Ka hale-runa kase hale-motu vali poro mali-runa.
example.gloss: DECL doctor choose treatment good for patient
example.english: The doctor chooses the best treatment for the patient.

example.voku: Ka mali-runa pave eno hale-loka.
example.gloss: DECL patient wait in hospital
example.english: The patient waits in the hospital.

example.voku: Ka hala-mali ure mali poro soma.
example.gloss: DECL disease be harmful for body
example.english: Disease is harmful to the body.

words.etymology: from savi (safe/protect) + hale (heal) — protective healing substance

example.voku: Ka savi-hale savi soma eso hala-mali.
example.gloss: DECL vaccine protect body from disease
example.english: A vaccine protects the body from disease.

example.voku: Ka mali-runa neke hale-miru lomi.
example.gloss: DECL patient need therapy long
example.english: The patient needs long-term therapy.

words.etymology: from kire (cut) + hale (heal) — healing through cutting/surgery

example.voku: Ka mali-runa neke kire-hale poro fike soma-kila.
example.gloss: DECL patient need surgery for fix organ
example.english: The patient needs surgery to fix the organ.

words.etymology: from hale (heal) + sire (write) — healing written order

example.voku: Ka hale-runa sire hale-sire poro hale-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL doctor write prescription for medicine
example.english: The doctor writes a prescription for medicine.

words.etymology: from pile (push/force) + kiru (logic/principle) — physical force principle

example.voku: Ka pile-kiru meke kosa move.
example.gloss: DECL force make thing move
example.english: Force makes things move.

example.voku: Ka take-kiru mu-meke-pu en mu-rupe-pu.
example.gloss: DECL energy NEG-create-PASS and NEG-destroy-PASS
example.english: Energy is neither created nor destroyed.

example.voku: Ka havi-kiru mire-pu eno noma-kila.
example.gloss: DECL mass measure-PASS in number-unit
example.english: Mass is measured in units.

example.voku: Ka rapi-kiru mire-pu eno kema poro tema.
example.gloss: DECL velocity measure-PASS in distance per time
example.english: Velocity is measured in distance per time.

example.voku: Ka luma move ulo move-foma.
example.gloss: DECL light move via wave
example.english: Light moves as a wave.

example.voku: Ka luma take eni move-foma eni puli-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL light act as wave as particle
example.english: Light behaves as both a wave and a particle.

words.etymology: from fale (fall) + kiru (principle) — falling force principle

example.voku: Ka fale-kiru pure tor kosa eko tera.
example.gloss: DECL gravity pull all thing toward earth
example.english: Gravity pulls all things toward the earth.

example.voku: Ka pile-zena ure aro tor havi-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL field be around all massive-object
example.english: A field exists around all massive objects.

words.etymology: from puli (small/minimal) + kiru (logic) — minimal logic unit/quantum

example.voku: Ka puli-kiru pine reku de-take-kiru eno puli-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL quantum define rule of-energy in particle
example.english: Quantum mechanics defines energy rules at the particle level.

example.voku: Ka sola sure sure-take-kiru eko tor kema.
example.gloss: DECL sun send radiation toward all direction
example.english: The sun emits radiation in all directions.

example.voku: Ka sami-kiru pine ta du kosa ure sami ti.
example.gloss: DECL equation define REL two thing be equal
example.english: An equation states that two things are equal.

words.etymology: from kiru (logic) + fone (call/invoke) — callable logic operation

example.voku: Ka kiru-fone mute kela-zike eko kela-zere.
example.gloss: DECL function change input toward output
example.english: A function transforms input into output.

example.voku: Ka sami-kiru tuve du muta-noma.
example.gloss: DECL equation have two variable
example.english: The equation has two variables.

example.voku: Ka sami-noma mu-mute-pu.
example.gloss: DECL constant NEG-change-PASS
example.english: A constant does not change.

words.etymology: from veri (true) + kema (path) — path to truth/proof

example.voku: Ka sol fi-meke veri-kema de-kiru-reku.
example.gloss: DECL 1SG COMPL-create proof of-theorem
example.english: I completed the proof of the theorem.

example.voku: Ka kiru-reku veri-pu ulo veri-kema.
example.gloss: DECL theorem verify-PASS via proof
example.english: A theorem is verified through a proof.

example.voku: Ka supa-kule kule tor puli-kosa eno kema.
example.gloss: DECL integral compute all small-part in range
example.english: An integral computes all small parts over a range.

words.etymology: from mute (change) + mire (measure) — rate of change

example.voku: Ka mute-mire mire rapi de-mute.
example.gloss: DECL derivative measure speed of-change
example.english: A derivative measures the rate of change.

example.voku: Ka noma-foma sere noma eno foma-turi.
example.gloss: DECL matrix store number in grid-structure
example.english: A matrix stores numbers in a grid structure.

example.voku: Ka na-kiru mire-pu eso nul eko un.
example.gloss: DECL probability measure-PASS from zero toward one
example.english: Probability is measured from zero to one.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa pine pine-veri te-ine luke-miru.
example.gloss: DECL researcher design hypothesis before-start experiment
example.english: The researcher designs a hypothesis before the experiment.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa take luke-miru poro veri pine-veri.
example.gloss: DECL researcher do experiment for verify hypothesis
example.english: The researcher conducts an experiment to verify the hypothesis.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa supa luke-kela poro luke.
example.gloss: DECL researcher collect data for evaluation
example.english: The researcher collects data for analysis.

example.voku: Ka luke-resa veri pine-veri.
example.gloss: DECL result verify hypothesis
example.english: The results verify the hypothesis.

example.voku: Ka kire-kela voke ta luke-kela pine vel ti.
example.gloss: DECL analysis show REL data mean what
example.english: The analysis shows what the data means.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa pine tore-motu te-ine luke-miru.
example.gloss: DECL researcher define method before-start experiment
example.english: The researcher defines the method before the experiment.

words.etymology: from velri (they/others) + luke (evaluate) — others' evaluation/peer review

example.voku: Ka tore-sire neke velri-luke te-ine sure-pu.
example.gloss: DECL paper need peer-review before-start publish-PASS
example.english: A paper needs peer review before being published.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa sure-sire luke-resa eno tore-sire.
example.gloss: DECL researcher publish result in paper
example.english: The researcher publishes results in a paper.

words.etymology: from luke (evaluate) + supa (group) — evaluation sample group

example.voku: Ka luke-supa tuve vas-heno mali-runa.
example.gloss: DECL sample have hundred patient
example.english: The sample has a hundred patients.

example.voku: Ka luke-miru neke sami-luke poro luke-pu veri.
example.gloss: DECL experiment need control for evaluate-PASS true
example.english: An experiment needs a control to be evaluated properly.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa tore kela poro kele viva.
example.gloss: DECL researcher search data for understand life
example.english: The researcher searches for data to understand life.

example.voku: Ka sol lire tore-sire de-mute-viva.
example.gloss: DECL 1SG read paper of-evolution
example.english: I read a paper on evolution.

example.voku: Ka hale-runa luke soma de-mali-runa.
example.gloss: DECL doctor evaluate body of-patient
example.english: The doctor examines the patient.

example.voku: Ka sol take hala-luke tor zela.
example.gloss: DECL 1SG do check-up every year
example.english: I do a check-up every year.

example.voku: Ka hila tuve homi-soma alati.
example.gloss: DECL child have fever high
example.english: The child has a high fever.

example.voku: Ka sol tole tole-mali eno kara.
example.gloss: DECL 1SG feel pain in head
example.english: I feel pain in my head.

words.etymology: from hema (blood) + miru (process) — blood analysis process

example.voku: Ka hale-runa hire hema-miru poro tore-mali.
example.gloss: DECL doctor request blood-test for diagnosis
example.english: The doctor requests a blood test for diagnosis.

words.etymology: from hale-kosa (medicine) + mali (bad) — medicine bad effect

example.voku: Ka par hale-kosa tuve hale-kosa-mali.
example.gloss: DECL some medicine have side-effect
example.english: Some medicines have side effects.

words.etymology: from viva (life) + mute (change) — life code change/mutation

example.voku: Ka viva-mute mute viva-koda.
example.gloss: DECL mutation change gene
example.english: A mutation changes a gene.

example.voku: Ka viva-pula-kire kes tire de-soma.
example.gloss: DECL cell-division cause growth of-body
example.english: Cell division causes body growth.

words.etymology: from viva-supa (species) + kiru (logic) — species classification logic

example.voku: Ka viva-supa-kiru pine ve viva supa-pu ti.
example.gloss: DECL taxonomy define how life classify-PASS
example.english: Taxonomy defines how life is classified.

words.etymology: from luma (light) + mire (measure) — light-based measuring/viewing device

example.voku: Ka tore-runa veke viva-pula ulo luma-mire.
example.gloss: DECL researcher see cell via microscope
example.english: The researcher sees cells through a microscope.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa veke sana ulo sana-mire.
example.gloss: DECL researcher see star via telescope
example.english: The researcher observes stars through a telescope.

example.voku: Ka mali-runa vine eno hale-loka.
example.gloss: DECL patient arrive in hospital
example.english: The patient arrives at the hospital.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa take eno tore-loka.
example.gloss: DECL researcher work in laboratory
example.english: The researcher works in the laboratory.

example.voku: Ka kona-kosa-sire supa tor kona-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL periodic-table list all element
example.english: The periodic table lists all elements.

example.voku: Ka ama-kire kire ama eko du kona-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL electrolysis split water toward two element
example.english: Electrolysis splits water into two elements.

words.etymology: from mute (change) + take-kiru (energy) + kiru (logic) — energy change logic

example.voku: Ka mute-take-kiru pine reku de-homi en take-kiru.
example.gloss: DECL thermodynamics define rule of-heat and energy
example.english: Thermodynamics defines the rules of heat and energy.

example.voku: Ka nul kosa move rapi ani luma-rapi.
example.gloss: DECL nothing move fast more-than light-speed
example.english: Nothing moves faster than the speed of light.

example.voku: Ka kule-kiru hele tore-runa kele luke-kela.
example.gloss: DECL statistics help researcher understand data
example.english: Statistics helps researchers understand data.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa meke kiru-pine poro kele viva-teru.
example.gloss: DECL researcher create model for understand ecosystem
example.english: The researcher creates a model to understand the ecosystem.

example.voku: Ka tore-runa take supa-mire de-mani runa.
example.gloss: DECL researcher do survey of-many person
example.english: The researcher conducts a survey of many people.

words.etymology: from tore (search/research) + kiru (logic) — research logic framework/theory

example.voku: Ka tore-kiru pine ve tor kosa take-me ti.
example.gloss: DECL theory explain how all thing interact
example.english: A theory explains how things interact.

example.voku: Ka havi-kiru mire-pu eno noma-kila de-havi.
example.gloss: DECL mass measure-PASS in unit of-weight
example.english: Mass is measured in units of weight.

example.voku: Ka kiru-fone ore kela-zike en meke kela-zere.
example.gloss: DECL function receive input and make output
example.english: A function receives input and produces output.

example.voku: Ka kela-zere ure veri si kela-zike ure veri.
example.gloss: DECL output be correct if input be correct
example.english: Output is correct if the input is correct.

words.etymology: from viva (life) + hale (heal) + kiru (logic/science) — life healing science

example.voku: Ka viva-hale-kiru tore ve hale-kosa take eno soma ti.
example.gloss: DECL pharmacology research how medicine act in body
example.english: Pharmacology studies how medicines act in the body.

words.etymology: from hale (heal) + luke-miru (experiment) — healing experiment/clinical trial

example.voku: Ka hale-kosa novi neke hale-luke-miru te-ine pore-tina-pu.
example.gloss: DECL medicine new need clinical-trial before sell-PASS
example.english: New medicines need clinical trials before being sold.

words.etymology: from soma (body) + savi (safe/protect) + teru (system) — body protection system

example.voku: Ka soma-savi-teru savi soma eso mali-puli-viva.
example.gloss: DECL immune-system protect body from bacteria
example.english: The immune system protects the body from bacteria.

example.voku: Ka viva-kiru tore ve viva take ti.
example.gloss: DECL biology research how life work
example.english: Biology studies how life works.

example.voku: Ka kosa-kiru tore ve kona-kosa mute-me en fuse-me ti.
example.gloss: DECL chemistry research how element change-RECIP and combine-RECIP
example.english: Chemistry studies how elements change and combine.

example.voku: Ka move-kiru tore ve kosa move en take-me ti.
example.gloss: DECL physics research how thing move and interact
example.english: Physics studies how things move and interact.

example.voku: Ka noma-kiru pine reku de-noma en foma.
example.gloss: DECL mathematics define rule of-number and structure
example.english: Mathematics defines the rules of numbers and structures.

example.voku: Ka sol teme-tina hale-kosa eno hale-kosa-loka.
example.gloss: DECL 1SG buy medicine in pharmacy
example.english: I buy medicine at the pharmacy.

example.voku: Ka hale-runa pine hale-sire de-mali-puli-viva-savi.
example.gloss: DECL doctor write prescription of-antibiotic
example.english: The doctor prescribes an antibiotic.

example.voku: Ka sene-kila mire homi-mire de-afa.
example.gloss: DECL sensor measure temperature of-air
example.english: The sensor measures the air temperature.

example.voku: Ka havi-kosa tuve fale-kiru vasi.
example.gloss: DECL massive-object have gravity large
example.english: Massive objects have strong gravity.

words.etymology: from puli (small) + viva (life) — small life form

example.voku: Ka puli-viva vere eno tor loka.
example.gloss: DECL microorganism live in all place
example.english: Microorganisms live everywhere.

example.voku: Ka noma-kema voke luke-kela eno foma veke.
example.gloss: DECL graph show data in structure visual
example.english: A graph shows data in a visual structure.

example.voku: Ka kiru-tura ure alati eno move-kiru.
example.gloss: DECL symmetry be important in physics
example.english: Symmetry is important in physics.

words.etymology: from homa (numb, variant) + hale (heal) — numbing for healing

example.voku: Ka mali-runa ore homa-hale te-ine kire-hale.
example.gloss: DECL patient receive anesthesia before surgery
example.english: The patient receives anesthesia before surgery.

words.etymology: from veke (see) + soma (body) + kila (tool) — body viewing tool

example.voku: Ka hale-runa ule veke-soma-kila poro veke asa.
example.gloss: DECL doctor use x-ray for see bone
example.english: The doctor uses X-ray to see bones.

example.voku: Ka noma sere-pu eno foma-turi.
example.gloss: DECL number store-PASS in grid
example.english: Numbers are stored in a grid.

example.voku: Ka hale-kosa-meke neke mani zela en mani tina.
example.gloss: DECL drug-development need many year and many money
example.english: Drug development needs many years and much money.

example.voku: Ka viva-koda-mute pote hale hala-mali ta he-sena eno viva-koda ti.
example.gloss: DECL genetic-engineering can heal disease REL origin in gene
example.english: Genetic engineering can treat diseases with genetic origins.

example.voku: Ka suli-kosa-kiru tore foma de-suli-kosa.
example.gloss: DECL atomic-physics study structure of-atom
example.english: Atomic physics studies the structure of atoms.

example.voku: Ka hale-runa-supa take kire-hale kono.
example.gloss: DECL medical-team do surgery together
example.english: The medical team performs surgery together.
